explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper discusses clustering financial data using matrix factorization, which is an unsupervised learning technique.
explanations.clustering: The paper focuses on clustering financial time series data using a constrained nonnegative matrix factorization method.
explanations.principal components analysis: The paper mentions independent component analysis (ICA) as a comparison method, which is related to principal components analysis (PCA).
explanations.feature representation: The paper uses matrix factorization to generate grouping knowledge, which involves learning feature representations of financial data.
explanations.representation learning: The proposed NSMF method learns underlying bases (representations) from financial data, which is a form of representation learning.
